I knew it would be folly to have such a young boy in what amounts to a war zone, and sure enough...he's a casualty.

But he's not dead...yet, and that's where you come in.

For me to work my herbal magic, I need the blossoms of hazevines. The boy doesn't know it, but he's lucky. Hazevine is underground nine months of the year.

Those blossoms aren't a secret exactly. But they grow only here, so knowledge of their medicinal uses is rather obscure.

The boy will awaken soon enough. His body is on the mend, and that's what counts.

When he rises, I'll be sure to tell him of the kind soldier who saved his life.

Look, everyone else wants you to slay all these lethal enemies or recover world-shattering artifacts.

I'm just asking you to... Pick. Some. Flowers.

Kids today. No appreciation for light duty.
